definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91

sentences.english: Behind the thick lens of her glasses her blue-green eyes 3)clouded with concern.
sentences.chinese: 透過厚厚的眼鏡片，她那藍綠色的眼睛滿是擔憂。

sentences.english: He scrambled widely to pick up the broken glasses before his guests could see them.
sentences.chinese: 他手忙腳亂地去揀摔壞了的眼鏡片，免得讓客人看見。

sentences.english: He peered at me through thick glasses.
sentences.chinese: 他透過厚厚的眼鏡片盯看着我。

sentences.english: Dr Khan sighed and peered over the frames of his glasses.
sentences.chinese: 卡恩醫生嘆着氣，透過他的眼鏡片凝視着。

sentences.english: Do you like this glass lens shape?
sentences.chinese: 您喜歡這種眼鏡片形狀嗎？

sentences.english: When I drink tea, my glasses mist over.
sentences.chinese: 我喝茶時眼鏡片上會蒙上一層水汽。
